invalidSymbolsDialog.title: Invalid configuration
invalidSymbolsDialog.desc: Some graphics and/or widgets have been configured for symbols that are no longer part of your GAMS/MIRO data contract or are hidden. Do you want to remove them from your configuration? Note that this cannot be undone! Graphic configuration for invalid symbol(s): '%s'. Widget configuration for invalid symbol(s): '%s'.

custom.li1: Create a directory renderer_%s in your model directory with a file %s_custom.R in it.
custom.li2: Copy the above code and paste it into the %s_custom.R file.
custom.li3a: Write your own custom renderer! For a detailed description of how to write such a custom renderer, see
custom.description1: The next time the application is started after a click on save MIRO looks for a custom renderer function in the file %s_custom.R. If this is not found, the application does not start! Make sure that you have included the custom renderer function correctly. It is always a good idea to first develop a custom renderer isolated from MIRO and, as soon as you are satisfied with the result, to integrate it into the MIRO application.
custom.description3: If your application doesn't start because of the reason mentioned above, you can always delete the configured renderer here.

ui.title: General settings
ui.headerTabSymlinks: Use output data as input data
ui.baseScriptsTooltip: Run custom analysis scripts which will be displayed in the output section
ui.hcubeScriptsTooltip: Run custom analysis scripts for multiple scenarios at once

modalDialog.title: Error copying image
modalDialog.content: A problem occurred copying image. If this problem persists, please contact a system administrator.

scen.label: Default scenario comparison mode
choices: Split view (suited for 2 scenarios to compare)
Tab view (suited for > 2 scenarios to compare)
Pivot view (suited for > 2 scenarios to compare)

defaultScenName.checkbox: Use a default scenario that will be loaded on startup?
defaultScenName.tooltip: Allows you to pre-populate tables and widgets with data when starting MIRO
defaultScenName.label: Name of the default scenario

args.label: Specify extra command line arguments that GAMS will be called with

symlinks.label: Specify symbol links (results that can be used as input data)

scripts.base: Specify custom analysis scripts for the Base Mode
scripts.hcube: Specify custom analysis scripts for the Hypercube Mode

overwriteSheetOrder.input: Specify the tab order of the input symbols (drag & drop)
overwriteSheetOrder.output: Specify the tab order of the output symbols (drag & drop)

hiddenOutputSymbols.label: Symbols that should not be displayed but can be used in graphs etc.

hiddenOutputScalars.label: Scalars that should not be displayed in the scalars table but can be used in graphs etc.

pivotcolor.label: Background color of row and column headers in pivot tables.

mirologfile.label: Enter the name of the MIRO log file (if available). Minimum 3 characters.

readme.label: README file
readme.readmeTooltip: A README file is displayed in the input section as an individual start page

dialogEdit.title: Readme editor
dialogEdit.msgErrSave: Problems writing the README file. Check whether you have sufficient write permissions in your model directory.

saveDuration.label: Duration the GAMS log and lst files are stored in the database (in days).

decimal.label: Number of decimal places used for rounding numerical values (global setting).
decimal.tooltip: Has an effect on all output tables, big data input tables and the table for loading scenarios in Hypercube Mode. - Open documentation.

logo.label: Upload a custom logo for your MIRO app: png/jpg file (best format: 4.6:1 or 230:50px)

actStrict.label: Launch app in strict mode? This results in throwing error messages instead of accepting possibly faulty user entries.

actUpload.title: Enables the user to use local data for GAMS runs
actUpload.label: Activate local data upload module?

actShareScen.label: Enable scenario sharing between different users

actAttach.title: Can be files of any format. MIRO distinguishes between two types of attachments: attachments that can be seen and read by your GAMS model and files that can not be seen.
actAttach.label: Should users be allowed to add attachments to scenarios?

aggregate.title: If not activated, each input widget is displayed in a separate tab.
aggregate.label: Should all input widgets (slider, dropdown menu, etc.) be aggregated on a single tab?

parent.label: Include parent directory of the model folder in your model runs (e.g. because several models share files)?

meta.title: Metadata contains information about the user name, the scenario name and the creation time of the scenario
meta.label: Include a metadata sheet in the Excel file (when exporting a scenario)?

empty.title: Sheets can be empty e.g. when the exported scenario only contains input data.
empty.label: Include empty sheets in the Excel file?

downloadTempFiles.label: Allow access to the temporary directory?

saveTrace.title: For performance analysis with the integrated analysis tool PAVER, this option needs to be activated.
saveTrace.label: Save trace file with each GAMS run (Hypercube Mode)

auto.label: Generate graphs for each input symbol automatically (pivot tool)

hot.readonly: Restrict editing of tables? If activated, tables can not be modified by the user.
hot.colwidth: Width of a single (non-streched) column. Leave empty or 0 to set the default value.
hot.enable: Enable table context menu (accessible via right mouse click).

pagelength.label: Number of items to display per page

decimals.label: Number of decimal places to display

buttons.title: If a symbol contains multiple table pages, using an export button only affects the currently visible table page!
buttons.select: Select buttons to use. Note: All button functions only affect the visible table page.

removeDialog.title: Please confirm
removeDialog.message: Are you sure that you want to reset the existing configuration for this symbol? This cannot be undone!

symbol.noGraph: Only display the table and no graphic for this symbol

saveJson.warnContent: According to the configuration, no graphic should be displayed for the symbol '%s'. A graph configuration already exists for this symbol. Do you want to overwrite this configuration? This cannot be undone!

ui.noWidgetMsg: No widget has been configured yet

ui.optionConfigMsg: Info: The symbol you selected is a GAMS option: %s

validate.val1: The alias of the element must not be empty!
validate.val2: The name of the double-dash parameter must not be empty!
validate.val3: The name of the GAMS option must not be empty!
validate.val7: The default value must be a number in the range [min, max]!
validate.val8: The tick identifier must be boolean!
validate.val9: The step size must be a number!
validate.val10: Your dropdown menu must have the same number of aliases as choices or no aliases at all!
validate.val11: The default value must be one of the choices you specified!
validate.val16: The default date must be after the start date!
validate.val17: The default date must be before the end date!
validate.val18: The earliest date must be before the latest date!
validate.val19: Minimum length for custom date format is 1!
validate.val24: The start date must be after the earliest date!
validate.val25: The end date must be before the latest date!
validate.val26: The start date must be after the earliest date!
validate.val27: The end date must be before the latest date!
validate.val28: The earliest date must be before the latest date!
validate.val29: Minimum length for custom date format is 1!
validate.val30: The start date must be before the end date!
validate.val31: The earliest date must be before the latest date!
validate.val32: The readonly identifier must be boolean!
validate.val33: The heatmap identifier must be boolean!
validate.val34: Some columns you selected to be readonly do not exist in the symbol currently selected!
validate.val36: The group name must be at least 1 character long.
validate.val37: Each group must have at least 2 members and every element may only appear in a single group!
validate.val38: At least one choice has to be specified!
validate.val39: No space allowed in the name!
validate.val42: The minimum value must be lower than the maximum value!
validate.val43: For a slider range 2 default values need to be defined!
validate.val45: The name of the command line parameter must be at least 1 character long.
validate.val46: Please specify command line arguments and values separately.
validate.val47: Source and target symbol must have the same dimension!
validate.val48: The minimum step size must not be less than zero.
validate.val49: The script identifier must not be empty and must only contain alphanumeric characters!
validate.val50: The script identifier must be unique!
validate.val55: Only one item can be selectable in the dropdown menu if only the element text is communicated with GAMS.
validate.val56: An attachment with this file name already exists!
validate.val57: The file name contains invalid characters. Attachments in subdirectories are not supported!
validate.val58: The decimal separator and the thousand grouping separator must not be identical!
validate.val59: The GAMS symbol: %s is declared as table. This causes the last column to be pivoted in MIRO. MIRO pivot cannot be used with already pivoted symbols. Please declare the symbol as a parameter instead.
validate.val60: Each group member may only appear in a single group!

table.label: Label (Markdown is supported)
table.type: Select the type of table you want to use

slider.label: Choose a label
slider.dep: Select symbol and header to depend upon
slider.minStepTooltip: Only relevant in Hypercube Mode. If empty, the step size is used. - Open documentation
slider.hcube: Should element be expanded automatically in Hypercube Mode?

sliderrange.label: Choose a label
sliderrange.dep: Select symbol and header to depend upon
sliderrange.hcube: Should element be expanded automatically in Hypercube Mode?

dropdown.label: Choose a label

choiceDep.label: Select symbol and header to depend upon
choiceDep.type: Should this dropdown menu be used for filtering other tables?

dropdown.clearValue: Communicate as element text with GAMS
dropdown.clearValueTooltip: Causes element label to be an empty string. - Open documentation
dropdown.hcube: Should element be expanded automatically in Hypercube Mode?

checkbox.label: Choose a label
checkbox.hcube: Should element be expanded automatically in Hypercube Mode?

date.label: Choose a label
date.format: Choose how you want the date to be formatted.

startview.label: What date range should be displayed per default?

weekstart.label: What day shall be the start of the week?

date.daysDisabled: Select weekdays that you want to disable
date.autoclose: Should datepicker be closed immediately when a date is selected?
date.hcube: Should element be expanded automatically in Hypercube Mode?

daterange.label: Choose a label
daterange.format: Choose how you want the date to be formatted.

startview.label: What date range is shown per default?

weekstart.label: What day shall be the start of the week?

daterange.separator: Select the separator between start and end date selector
daterange.autoclose: Should datepicker be closed immediately when a date range is selected?
daterange.hcube: Should element be expanded automatically in Hypercube Mode?

textinput.label: Choose a label
textinput.clearValue: Communicate as element text with GAMS
textinput.clearValueTooltip: Causes element label to be an empty string. - Open documentation

removeDialog.title: Please confirm
removeDialog.message: Are you sure that you want to delete the existing configuration for this symbol? This cannot be undone!

database.title: Database management
database.restoreNoData: No csv files found in the archive provided. Nothing was restored.
database.restoreInvalidData: At least one of the tables is invalid. Nothing was restored.
database.maxRowError: The maximum number of rows to export was exceeded for atleast 1 table. Please back up the database manually!
database.backupWrapper: You want to create a backup of the database? Click the button below to get a zip archive with all the database tables saved into csv files. Be aware that it is faster to backup your database using the native backup tool of your DBMS. This means that in case of big databases you should backup your database manually!
database.restoreWrapper: You want to restore the database with data from an existing zip file? Please select the file you want to use to restore the database below.
database.removeWrapper: You want to remove all the tables that belong to your model (e.g. because the schema changed)?
database.removeDialogDesc: Are you sure that you want to delete all database tables that belong to the model? This can not be undone! You might want to save the database first before proceeding.
database.removeOrphansWrapper: You want to remove all the orphaned tables that belong to your model?
database.removeOrphansDialogDesc: Are you sure that you want to delete all orphaned database tables that belong to the model? This can not be undone! You might want to save the database first before proceeding.
database.removeInconsistent: You want to remove all the inconsistent tables?
database.removeInconsistentConfirm: Are you sure that you want to delete all inconsistent database tables that belong to the model?
database.cannotBeUndone: This can not be undone! You might want to save the database first before proceeding.

ui.title: Configure graphs
ui.localInput: Upload a GDX file or an Excel spreadsheet with data that will be used for preview purposes
ui.chartTitle: Choose a title for your chart
ui.height: Choose a height for your chart (px) (no live preview)

validate.val1: Could not set range for x axis. Check for correct data format!
validate.pieValues: The selected symbol has too many values to be displayed as a pie chart. The maximum number of values that can be displayed in a pie chart is 100.
validate.tableNeeded: A symbol that is to be configured as a map must be declared as a GAMS table, since multiple value columns are required (e.g. latitude and longitude information).

errMsg.errContent1: No valid datasets were found. Please upload a properly formatted Excel or gdx file with data.
errMsg.scalarConfig: The configuration for input scalars is done in '

axisOptions.title: Axis label
axisOptions.range: Set axis range. The format has to match the data format. When not specified, a default is used.

chartOptions.xdata: What should be plotted on the x axis?
chartOptions.color: Select the domain to be grouped for plotting. Colors are only valid, when no line or marker colors are set
chartOptions.symbol: Select a dimension to map to different symbols. No marker symbol must be set.

options.title: Options
options.paperBgColor: What background color shall the paper have?
options.plotBgColor: What background color shall the plot have?
options.fixedHeight: Fix chart height (px) - Leave empty or 0 for default
options.fixedWidth: Fix chart width (px) - Leave empty or 0 for default
options.outType: Show graphic and data table in split screen? (no live preview)

barOptions.width: Domain that is used to select different bar widths

valueboxOptions.width: Maximum number of boxes per row (no preview)
valueboxOptions.icon: Specify an icon for the valuebox (optional).

animationOptions.title: Animation options
animationOptions.transition: Duration of the smooth transition between frames (in milliseconds).
animationOptions.redraw: Trigger a redraw of the plot at completion of the transition? (this may significantly impact performance, but may be necessary to update graphical elements that can't be transitioned.)
animationOptions.mode: How shall new animate calls interact with currently-running animations?
animationOptions.noAnimation: No domain selected for animation (category: Y data).

animationSliderOptions.label: Label to appear on the slider
animationSliderOptions.fontColor: What font color should be used for the slider label?

normChoices: Number of occurances/ Bin interval size
histOptions.barmode: How do you want the bars to be displayed?
histOptions.alpha: Opacity of bars (only valid if no bar color is set)

dygraphsOptions.previewError: No scalar indices found in your data.
dygraphsOptions.xdata: What index do you want to plot on the x-axis?
dygraphsOptions.color: Select the domain to be grouped for plotting.

rngSelOpts.title: Range selector options
rngSelOpts.activate: Do you want to see a range selector?
rngSelOpts.height: How high should it be (in px)?
rngSelOpts.retainDateWindow: Should current date range be kept when graph is redrawn?
rngSelOpts.keepMouseZoom: Do you still want to be able to zoom with the mouse?
rngSelOpts.fillColor: What fill color should be used?
rngSelOpts.strokeColor: What stroke color should be used?

generalOpts.title: General options
generalOpts.stepPlot: Do you want a step plot?
generalOpts.stemPlot: Do you want a stem plot?
generalOpts.fillGraph: Should the area underneath the graph be filled?

axisOptions.title: Label
axisOptions.valueRange: Set axis range. The format has to match the data format. When not specified, a default is used.

highOpts.title: Highlighting options
highOpts.activate: Would you like to see highlighting effects?
highOpts.circleSize: What shall the circle size be (in px)?
highOpts.seriesBackgroundAlpha: Choose the opacity of the background
highOpts.strokeBorderWidth: Draw a border around highlighted lines
highOpts.hideOnMouseOut: Hide highlighting effects when mouse is moved out of chart?

legend.title: Legend options
legend.show: How should the legend be displayed?
legend.showZeroValues: Show zero value labels in the legend
legend.hideOnMouseOut: Hide legend when mouse is moved out of chart?

leafletOptions.hideGroups: Select groups that should be hidden on startup

layer.title: Layer control options
layer.baseGroups: Which base groups shall be selectable?
layer.overlayGroups: Which overlay groups shall be selectable?
layer.collapsed: Shall layer control panel be collapsed?

timevisOptions.custom: Add a vertical bar at a time point that can be dragged by the user (no preview available)

options.title: Gantt chart options
options.showZoom: Include 'Zoom In' / 'Zoom Out' buttons? Zoom can also be done via ctrl + mouse wheel
options.zoomFactor: Zoom factor? Zooming out from 20 days with a zoom factor of 1 will results in showing 40 days. No preview available.
options.fit: Fit all data on the timeline when the timeline initializes? Otherwise, the timeline will be set to show the current date.
options.showCurrentTime: Show a vertical bar at the current time?

miroPivotOptions.infoMsg: Please use directly the preview on the right side to configure the default view.
miroPivotOptions.hideEmptyColsSwitch: Activate switch to hide empty columns
miroPivotOptions.pivotCompHideEmptyColsSwitch: Pivot Compare Mode: Activate switch to hide empty columns
miroPivotOptions.emptyUEL: UEL, which indicates a missing value (must not be empty string)
miroPivotOptions.infoMsgDummyData: Currently the preview uses dummy data. This means that the filters will have dummy values. If you want to change these, you have to edit the JSON configuration file manually.

pivotOptions.rows: Prepopulate rows of the pivot table
pivotOptions.cols: Prepopulate columns of the pivot table
pivotOptions.vals: Name of the column to aggregate.

options.title: Pivot table options
options.locale: Localization options. A change from 'en' to another language will cause the configuration of the used graphic to be lost.
options.subtotals: Should subtotal plugin be used? For examples, see:

customOptions.name: Name of the custom renderer function (no space)
customOptions.additionalData: Additional datasets to communicate with the custom renderer

filterOptions.filter: Should one domain of the symbol be selectable via a dropdown menu?
filterOptions.label: Label of the filter (no live preview)
filterOptions.multiple: Should several elements be selectable as filter at the same time? (No live preview for single dropdown menu available)
filterOptions.date: The data in the column to be filtered contain dates (times). No live preview available!

saveJson.warnContent: A graph configuration already exists for symbol: '%s'. Do you want to overwrite this configuration? This cannot be undone!

removeDialog.title: Please confirm
removeDialog.message: Are you sure that you want to delete the existing graph configuration for this symbol? This cannot be undone!

addInputGroup.groupSameTabIn: Show all symbols side by side on the same tab?
addInputGroup.groupSameTabWidget: Show all widgets side by side on the same tab?

addOutputGroup.groupSameTabOut: Show all symbols side by side on the same tab?

addSymlink.target: Name of the input symbol to link to

addScript.title: Script alias (displayed in UI)
addScript.outFile: Name of the output file (including file extension)

addOutAttach.file: Name of the file to attach
addOutAttach.exec: Allow model to read this file?
addOutAttach.error: Should an error be displayed if the file is not found?

addDyEvent.dyDyEventTrue: Set a date for the event (yyyy-mm-dd)
addDyEvent.label: What label should be used?
addDyEvent.color: What color should the event line have?

addDyLimit.dyDyLimitTrue: Set a numeric value for the limit
addDyLimit.limit: Set a numeric value for the limit
addDyLimit.label: What label should be used?
addDyLimit.color: What color should the limit line have?

addDyAnnotation.attachAtBottom: Should annotation be attached to x axis?

addDyShading.axis: Axis where shading shall be applied to

addLeafletMarkers.groupName: Choose a group name for these markers
addLeafletMarkers.label: Choose a label
addLeafletMarkers.labelcolor: Choose a font color for the label
addLeafletMarkers.labelbgcolor: Choose a background color for the label
addLeafletMarkers.labelsize: Choose a font size for the label (in px)

addLeafletFlows.leafletFlows: Select latitude data where flow originates
addLeafletFlows.lng: Select longitude data where flow originates
addLeafletFlows.lat1: Select latitude data where flow ends
addLeafletFlows.lng1: Select longitude data where flow ends
addLeafletFlows.label: Choose a unique label for each flow (optional)
addLeafletFlows.labelTooltip: A suitable configuration for a label is to specify the originator and the recipient for each flow - open documentation

addLeafletMinicharts.leafletMinicharts: Select latitude data where minichart should be plotted
addLeafletMinicharts.lng: Select longitude data where minichart should be plotted
addLeafletMinicharts.width: Choose the maximal width of the created elements
addLeafletMinicharts.height: Choose the maximal height of the created elements
addLeafletMinicharts.showlabels: Should values be displayed above chart elements?
addLeafletMinicharts.transitionTime: Select the duration of transitions when a property of a chart is updated (in milliseconds)
addLeafletMinicharts.legend: Should a legend (data column names) be visible?

addPieDataEl.chartName: Name of element (only relevant if multiple pie charts are displayed)

addBarDataEl.chartYdatabar: What should be plotted on the y axis?
addBarDataEl.color: Select bar color (delete color for automated selection)

addScatterDataEl.chartYdata: What should be plotted on the y axis?
addScatterDataEl.legend: Show legend? (this option could be overwritten by the by the global show legend option)
addScatterDataEl.frame: Use a data dimension for animation (as frames)?

addLineDataEl.chartYdata: What should be plotted on the y axis?
addLineDataEl.legend: Show legend? (this option could be overwritten by the by the global show legend option)
addLineDataEl.frame: Use a data dimension for animation (as frames)?

addBubbleDataEl.chartYdata: What should be plotted on the y axis?
addBubbleDataEl.colorCheckFalse: Select a domain on which the color should depend on.
addBubbleDataEl.sizemode: How should the size be measured?
addBubbleDataEl.legend: Show legend? (this option could be overwritten by the by the global show legend option)
addBubbleDataEl.frame: Use a data dimension for animation (as frames)?

addDyDataEl.chartYdata: What index do you want to plot on the y-axis?
addDyDataEl.label: What label should be used?
addDyDataEl.color: What color should be used for this series?
addDyDataEl.stepPlot: Do you want the series to be a step plot?
addDyDataEl.stemPlot: Do you want the series to be a stem plot?
addDyDataEl.fillGraph: Should the area underneath the graph be filled?

addTimevisDataEl.start: The start date of the items?
addTimevisDataEl.end: The end date of the items?
addTimevisDataEl.type: The type of the item? Note: Types box and point need only a start date, types range and background need both a start and end date.
addTimevisDataEl.title: Add a title for each item, displayed when hovering the mouse over it?
addTimevisDataEl.group: Group ID. When a group is provided, all items with the same group are placed on one line.
addTimevisDataEl.subgroup: Subgroup ID. Groups all items within a group per subgroup, and positions them on the same height instead of stacking them on top of each other.
addTimevisDataEl.grouptitle: Add a title for each group, displayed when hovering the mouse over it?
addTimevisDataEl.subgrouporder: Order the subgroups by a field name. By default, groups are ordered by first-come, first-show.
